intro: Adicea serratifolia, commonly known as the serrated leaf adicea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, serrated leaves that are often hairy on the underside. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators. Adicea serratifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
